page.title: 16Local History.
page.content: After William the Conqueror had become King of England he set about making the first{Domesday Book.}In our area there are three places that are mentioned in the Cheshire section of the original {Domesday Book}.They are Aston Juxta Mondrum,Poole and Worleston. These places were originally manors where people lived and worked on the land.They were very small places and very few people lived there. There may have been about 100 people altogether, because 800 years ago Cheshire was a very wild and lonely place that was covered with forests and waste land.There were very few people living in the County and those that did lived near Chester or up on the Wirral. Nowadays, Cheshire is a very crowded County and in our area alone there are nearly 100,000 people.
